critique: The document is an approval of a Code of Fair Competition for the Lumber and Timber Products Industries. The tone is formal and legalistic. The primary emotion the President wants to elicit is a sense of confidence and stability in the economy and industry. There is a sense of hope that the code will lead to fair competition and recovery. There is no explicit mention of emotions like joy, sadness, anger, fear, or disgust. Surprise is also not a primary emotion being conveyed. The initial scores are based on this assessment.
